channel.title: Notes on Rock 'n' Roh
channel.description: Recent content in Notes on Rock 'n' Roh

item.title: Bootstrapping and its Implementation in R
item.description: About Empirical Bootstrap (a.k.a Nonparametric Bootstrap) What is bootstrapping sample and how to generate it? Let’s take median as a parameter of distribution of our interest What is it for? Difference between real world and bootstrap world Empirical CDF Why does it work? Parametric Bootstrap References About This page is to provide a gentle introduction of Bootstrapping and its application in R and Python. I make my own summary of the materials related to the topic and the reference is provided in the end.

item.title: Rmd Note Sample Using both R, Python, and C
item.description: Head 1 Head 2 R example Python Example CPP example Latex Example References (Example) Note: This document is to provide a sample template for the lecture notes in .Rmd Memo: test Usage of singe quote x = 5 # radius of a circle For a circle with the radius 5, its area is 78.5398163. Head 1 Add link like this. Link Description Footnote example1 Footnote example22

item.title: Useful Websites
item.description: Note: This page is to provide a list of useful notes Blogdown https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/ https://www.storybench.org/how-to-build-a-website-with-blogdown-in-r/ Hugo version control in netlify by setting the environment variable. https://docs.netlify.com/configure-builds/environment-variables/#netlify-configuration-variables HUGO_VERSION We need to set this not to have ‘build-site’ error Building sites … ERROR 2020/10/15 16:41:28 render of "taxonomyTerm" failed: "/opt/build/repo/themes/hugo-xmin/layouts/_default/terms.html:8:21": execute of template failed: template: _default/terms.html:8:21: executing "_default/terms.html" at <.Page.RelPermalink>: can't evaluate field Page in type hugolib.WeightedPages

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
